text.section: A person is guilty of criminal possession of a noxious substance when he possesses such substance under circumstances evincing an intent unlawfully to use or cause it to be used to inflict injury upon or to cause annoyance to a person, or to damage property of another, or to disturb the public peace.
Criminal possession of a noxious substance is a Class B misdemeanor.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 110, effective January 1, 1975.
